name: Moss Rose
climate: Moss Rose thrives in hot, arid climates and is tolerant of drought.
This plant is well-suited to subtropical regions with low humidity.
In temperate climates, summer heat is vital for its robust growth.
Not frost-tolerant, requires a warm climate without cold spells.
sunlight: Prefers full sun exposure for most of the day to thrive and bloom.
Ensure at least six hours of direct sunlight for optimal growth.
Moss Rose blooms best with bright, uninterrupted sunlight daily.
Avoid shaded areas; inadequate light results in fewer flowers.
watering: Requires minimal watering once established due to drought tolerance.
Water sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out completely between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; ensure drainage is adequate.
In containers, water when the top inch of soil feels dry to touch.
soil: Favors sandy, well-draining soil with good aeration for root development.
Can tolerate and even thrive in poor, nutrient-deficient soils.
Avoid clayey soils as they may retain excess moisture, causing issues.
Amend dense soils with sand or perlite to improve drainage efficiency.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent blooms regularly to promote continuous flowering.
Trim leggy growth to maintain a more compact and attractive shape.
